ProofInvalid().details: This can mean that provided Groth16 proof points are not on their curves, that pairing equation fails, or that the proof is not for the provided public input.

PublicInputNotInField().details: Public input elements are not automatically reduced, as this is can be a dangerous source of bugs.

params.expected: The verifier selector from the first 4 bytes of the VERIFIER_HASH().
params.received: The verifier selector from the first 4 bytes of the proof.

params.input: the public input field elements in the scalar field Fr. Elements must be reduced.
params.proof: the points (A, B, C) in EIP-197 format matching the output of compressProof.
The uncompressed Groth16 proof. Elements are in the same order as for verifyProof. I.e. Groth16 points (A, B, C) encoded as in EIP-197.

returns.compressed: The compressed proof. Elements are in the same order as for verifyCompressedProof. I.e. points (A, B, C) in compressed format.

params.compressedProof: the points (A, B, C) in compressed format matching the output of compressProof.
params.input: the public input field elements in the scalar field Fr. Elements must be reduced.

params.programVKey: The verification key for the RISC-V program.
params.proofBytes: The proof of the program execution the SP1 zkVM encoded as bytes.
params.publicValues: The public values encoded as bytes.

InvalidProof().notice: Thrown when the proof is invalid.

PublicInputNotInField().notice: Some of the provided public input values are larger than the field modulus.

WrongVerifierSelector(bytes4,bytes4).notice: Thrown when the verifier selector from this proof does not match the one in this verifier. This indicates that this proof was sent to the wrong verifier.

VERIFIER_HASH().notice: Returns the hash of the verifier.

Verify(uint256[8],uint256[2]).notice: Verify an uncompressed Groth16 proof.Reverts with InvalidProof if the proof is invalid or with PublicInputNotInField the public input is not reduced.There is no return value. If the function does not revert, the proof was successfully verified.

compressProof(uint256[8]).notice: Compress a proof.Will revert with InvalidProof if the curve points are invalid, but does not verify the proof itself.

hashPublicValues(bytes).notice: Hashes the public values to a field elements inside Bn254.

verifyCompressedProof(uint256[4],uint256.notice: Verify a Groth16 proof with compressed points.Reverts with InvalidProof if the proof is invalid or with PublicInputNotInField the public input is not reduced.There is no return value. If the function does not revert, the proof was successfully verified.

verifyProof(bytes32,bytes,bytes).notice: Verifies a proof with given public values and vkey.

userdoc.notice: This contracts implements a solidity verifier for SP1.
